column1: We love our dogs. They love to race.

column3: Formpro Ratings Free Every Monday C1/C2

column1: DOUBLE WHAT (2) - hampered for a stride or so when contacted racing in to the bend
BELMONTS (3) - fav- dwelt slightly at the jump was jostled for a couple of strides racing in to the bend came back off heels losing some ground could not improve thereafter

VAN JACK (5) - hampered slightly and ran wide in to the bend lost ground thereafter finishing a margin in the rear at the line a veterinary examination found a left pectoral muscle injury Trainer D Denbee when questioned reported that the dog had been trialling well coming in to today's race ,this was the dogs first race start for 6 months.
MOTHER'S TOUCH (6) - raced wide in to the bend to race up handy across the top where she ran extremely wide in to the home straight to the line.

column5: Owned/Raced by: Brendon Cole & Tony Potts

column1: BORN FAB (1) - soon after the start checked out off heels and was further tightened and jostled racing in to the bend
TAZIA (3) - bumped soon after the start then checked by crossing runner

BIGTIME PUMA (4) - fav- dwelt slightly was then went inwards bumping with runner to his inner and went back had trouble clearing heels in to the bend when in clear racing room made very good ground to the line.
BIGTIME LEADS (5) - angled across from the jump causing tightening and checks to several runners to his inner for some strides.

BIGTIME SHEER (1) - severely hampered when checked in to the bend losing momentum back to the rear was unable to make ground thereafter a veterinary examination found a left side pectoral muscle injury.
JOHNY MOWHAWK (2) - crowded and checked catching heels in to the bend losing running wide losing all chance thereafter.
BIG TIME DUSTY (5) - racing handy in to the bend when contacted from behind and checked losing momentum and all chance thereafter.
BAVARO (6) - racing to the bend was tightened and jostled between runners for some strides was then forced to abruptly check out over heels going wide losing all chance thereafter.

PARIS END (7) - racing to the bend attempted to angle inwards causing severe tightening and checks to several runners to his inner for some strides and was almost dragged down making contact with the rail in to the bend made some ground in the run to the line a veterinary examination
BIG TIME ELSA (8) - raced widest to the bend was able to then angle inwards to race up handy ran wide in to the home straight to the line.
BIGTIME KISS (1) - fav-handy to the bend when tightened and jostled from her outer losing momentum and some ground was unable to make ground thereafter a veterinary examination

BILLY'S CHURN (2) - tightened and checked racing in to the bend going back between runners and was jostled for some distance losing ground back to the rear hampered again soon after when looking to improve was unable to make ground thereafter.

BIGTIME BEE (5) - awkwardly away for a stride or so then angled inwards was tightened and hampered racing in to the bend for some strides soon after came back off heels on the top bend made ground to the home turn could not finish on from there.
DYNAMITE DANGER (7) - contact and checked on the top bend only battled in the run to the line.
BIG TIME TINA (8) - dictated wider racing to the bend raced widest across the top bend and was checked came back off heels on the home turn when well out of contention.

column3: Tim Newbold (Aus) Calling Here March 16th C4

column1: BIGTIME BRONX (2) - angled inwards soon after the star twas contacted and pushed sideways for a couple of strides in to the bend kept his position at this point soon after was checked and lost ground finishing towards the rear at the line a veterinary examination found 3 punture wounds with minimal bruising right fore leg.
BIGTIME BRET (4) - tightened crowded and checked in to the bend losing momentum and ground recovered good ground thereafter.
BIGTIME THOR (9/6) - ran in to hindquarters and checked in to the bend ran extremely wide at this point angled inwards soon after was unable to make ground to the line.
This race was started 3 minutes over the scheduled starting time.
BIG TIME SPOT (3) - began awkwardly for a stride or so settled back contacted in to the bend and again soon after was unable to get in to contention thereafter.
BIGTIME BANJO (4) - improved between runners in to the bend ran wide and ran extremely wide in to the home straight effort told in the run to the line.
BIG TIME DYNASTY (6) - contact in to the bend losing momentum and ground was unable to get back in to contention thereafter.
BIG TIME BILLIE (7) - settled midfield in between runners contacted on the top bend unable to make ground thereafter.
This race started 2 minutes over the scheduled staring time.

WOMAN NO CRY (1) - dwelt and was last in to stride improved along the inner to race handy across the top bend improved and was forced to abruptly check out over heels on the home turn losing momentum and ground once balanced up made strong ground to the line.
BIG TIME HARLEY (5) - jostled between runners soon after the start and was checked back to the rear contacted heels in to the bend losing momentum and ground .
DANGEROUS DI (6) - contacted and bumped soon after the start tightened and was jostled back from between runners racing in to the bend was unable to make ground thereafter.
DOUBLE THAT (8) - raced handy across the top bend was clipped from behind on the home turn once balanced up finished best in the run to the line.
MIDNIGHT MOLLY (9/2) - led out to a clear early lead weakened in the latter stages of the run to the line.
SLAM IT (7) - settled back ran wide in to the bend angled inwards across the top bend could not make ground thereafter.
BIG LEAGUE DIVA (4) - racing between runners when checked on the home turn losing some momentum and ground.
BIG TIME BABY (8) - raced widest in to and around the bend was anable to make ground on the leaders in the run to the line.
KAMADA PARK (4) - crowded and checked in to the bend losing momentum and ground in the run on to the top bend
BIGTIME FOREST (5) - racing handy in to the bend when contacted in the hindquarters had some trouble clearing heels nearing the home turn could not make ground thereafter.
TUFF KNIGHT (6) - forced to check out over heels in to the bend racing wide made good ground to the line.
GAZZA'S GIRL (8) - raced wide as per her usual style covering extra ground in the running making good ground in the latter stages to the line.
BIGTIME DIESEL (9/2) - hampered when checked and lost ground in to the bend checked again on the top bend when catching heels was unable to make ground thereafter.
BIGTIME BENJI (2) - settled back came back off heels in to the bend contact with runner to her outer when looking to make ground near the home turn could not finish on.
BIGTIME ACACIA (3) - angled to the rail across the top bend checking runner to her inner.
ASK KING JEFF (5) - raced widest in to the bend and wide thereafter finishing on in the run to the line.
DJAY DYNAMIX (10/4) - led out trailed on to the top bend was checked on the top bend then contacted in the hindquarters soon after was uanble to make ground thereafter.

column3: City of Palmerston North Golden Chase Here March 27th C4/C5

column5: Owned/Raced by: Brendon Cole & Tony Potts

column1: BIGTIME ROD (1) - fav- away well jostled and checked in to the bend going back several lengths had trouble clearing heels across the top bend being held up when clearmade strong ground to the line
EMGRAND PARK (3) - settled back off midfield improved in to the home straight bumping with SIMPLY SMOOTH and was held up for some strides finished on in the latter stages to the line
BIG TIME SETH (4) - angled across in to the bend checking runner to his inner.
CHEESEBALL (5) - raced widest in to the bend and wide when attempting to make ground around the bend made some ground in the latter stages to the line.
SIMPLY SMOOTH (9/2) - soon after the start attempted to angle outwards held up on heels across the top bend bumped on the home
TRAJAN (3) - went up with the lids improved to be handy when tightened in to the bend losing some momentum and ground was unable to improve thereafter.

THRILLING HUDSON (4) - racing from the jump was contacted and went sideways for some strides and was checked back towards the rear was held up when clearing heels in the run across the top bend made very strong ground in the run to the line.
BIG TIME ANTON (5) - ran in bumping with THRILLING HUDSON from the jump
ALLEGRO LEXXI (6) - angled across from the jump running in to and checking THRILLING HUDSON for some strides
THRILLING IVY (7) - raced wide throughout covering a fair amount of extra ground in the running.
BIGTIME RONNIE (9/2) - settled back held up for some strides racing on to the top bend when unable to clear heels for a few strides was unable to improve to the line.

column3: Darryl Robinson Calling Here March 16th C1

column1: PENNY MOWHAWK (2) - contact soon after settled back ran on to heels and checked losing momentum and ground racing on to the top bend was unable to get in to contention thereafter.
PUNCH ON RUBY (3) - contact soon after the start settled midfield couldn't finish on to the line.
ALLEGRO WILL (5) - ran in from the jump checking runner to his inner for a stride.
CHAT YA LATER (6) - checked and lost momentum and ground racing on to the top bend was unable to make ground thereafter.
MORNING SUN (8) - began awkwardly for a stride or so.

ELOUERA MIST (1) - contact soon after the start then checked out over heels contacting PLAN STAN and was further jostled and went back a length or so soon after was hampered for some strides racing around the top bend costing her more ground ran on in the latter stages to the line.
PLAN STAN (3) - soon after the start was tightened and jostled for some strides being checked back to the rear ran wide in to the bend was unable to get back in to contention thereafter.
BIG TIME ABBI (4) - fav- dictated inwards soon after the start for a couple of strides ran wide when improving in to the bend .
EYE KNO (5) - jumped well then angled across tightening runners to his inner for a few strides.

ALLEGRO LANIE (6) - in the run to the bend was tightened and jostled between runners for some strides losing momentum jostled with runner on her outer racing on to the top bend losing ground was unable to get back in to contention thereafter.
BLACK MAGS (9/7) - soon after the start when improving she was bumped and checked for a couple of strides becoming unbalanced recovered back in to stride quickly to make ground.
The official website for Greyhound Racing New Zealand (GRNZ)
